website_summaries.verdict: An affordable introduction to the Norelco line of rotary electric shavers, ideal as a travel model or low cost replacement for aging shavers.
pros: Can be used for other body hair removal
Entry level price point, but mid-range performance
Includes a pop-up trimmer for beards and sideburns
cons: Can leave a layer of stubble behind
Skin irritation and razor burn reported

website_summaries.verdict: This razor is very easy and convenient to use without making a mess. It delivers a close shave every time.
pros: Lightweight design makes this a solid option for both everyday use and travel
Doesn’t drop bits of hair all over sink while in use
Razor head can be cleaned under faucet, which is convenient
Quick to use, saving users time

website_summaries.verdict: An affordable, entry-level rotary model that delivers a decent shave.
pros: Useful for trimming stubble and close shaves
cons: Motor is not as powerful as some high-end models

customer_reviews.title: This is fantastic. First of all
customer_reviews.text: This is fantastic. First of all, you can't beat the price. I got sick of constant ingrown hairs with using a straightedge. So, I tried this out and I highly recommend it. In order to have a buttery smooth shave, you need to use the green letric shave (preshave). Before you use the shaver, make sure you put a warm cloth on your face to open your pours. Then, put the shaver under hot water for a few minutes to get the blades warm. Then, pour letric shave on your blades and your face with a cotton ball and shave. If you follow this process, you will have the best shave ever, with no ingrown hairs. Hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: Liam

customer_reviews.title: Happy
customer_reviews.text: I'm impressed! I have a top of the line Braun Series 7 which I love and have had for well over a year. This shaver cuts closer and leaves my face and head smoother. It does this much faster than the Braun. I paid close to $300 for the Braun... I realize that the cutting performance of the Norelco will deteriorate as the blades dull. The Norelco is also very quiet and really easy to clean and it doesn't drop little bits of hair everywhere unlike the Braun. Since it cuts very close it is also pretty aggressive for sensitive skin but I'm adjusting well to it. I can't believe how much I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: N. Bergman

customer_reviews.title: You Get What You Pay For
customer_reviews.text: Started taking blood thinners so being very cautious I ordered this razor. Believing the good reviews, I felt confident that it would work well even given its bargain price. Mistake. Used it twice. Very poor shave and I don’t have a heavy beard. I used a pre-shave and it took forever to get as good of a shave as I could get. I think friction took more hair off than the blades. I didn’t expect a blade close shave but this was really poor. Don’t understand the good reviews. I returned it and I’ll risk using my blade again.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver

customer_reviews.title: Braun-10...Norelco-0
customer_reviews.text: Sideburn trimmer broke on my Braun 3 series & thought I'd try the Norelco...oops bad mistake. The trimmer works great but the actual shave is very bad. I have a medium beard & after 10 min. of shaving, I could still feel stubble & skin was burning. Back to the Braun.
customer_reviews.author: Bill A.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great shaver.
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Gave a great shave. Only my skin is sensitive so gave a slight rash. Though that is my skin′s fault , nothing to do with the shaver. The razor charges quickly and cuts whiskers well. Washing the razor under water makes cleaning easy. I would definitely buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher John Knight

customer_reviews.title: I'd recommend the fancier model
customer_reviews.text: Works as well as the fancier model but it's got an old school battery that takes like 8 hours to charge and short battery life. Brand new it will go a few weeks without having to charge, and I use it to shave my head, too. Shave is nice and close... obviously not as good as a razor. I've known people who get irritated skin with electric razors but I'm okay with them. Doesn't come with spare heads, charging base, brush or case. Not sure yet if it wouldn't have been better to just pay double for the nicer model like I usually do. A good deal if you see it for $25-$30.
customer_reviews.author: SeanTop Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: when it does it hurts pretty bad. I don't like it
customer_reviews.text: It sometimes Pulls my facial hair. when it does it hurts pretty bad. I don't like it. wish I could return it but the return date has passed. Ive had it about 2 Months and so far, its pulled my hair a few times bad.
customer_reviews.author: James Warren

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver
customer_reviews.text: Don't know why it's called an entry level item but it has very good performance. And like the fact that it can be rinsed in water compared to my old one which I had to take it apart, brush it, oil it and had to be careful not to get it wet.
customer_reviews.author: watchfreak

customer_reviews.title: Stops working after two charges
customer_reviews.text: It stopped working after two full charges. Are you kidding me? I am a female and I didn't even use it every day. It was a way to shave my legs faster on days I didn't really care about close shaves. I wasted 30 bucks for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: wini

customer_reviews.title: STOP WAITING.  JUNK THE OLD ONE
customer_reviews.text: DON'T WAIT ANYMORE!!! I had an old (and I mean really old) but more expensive model which I would not give up on even when I could olny get 2 shaves on a single battery charge. I would buy new blades ($25 or higher) and get a decent shave. After so many times of having a battery go dead in the middle of a shave I broke down and purchased this new 2100. Now I could kick myself in the butt for waiting. Will never buy the most expensive model as this shaver last though many many shaves and gives better result than the old one. Oh by the way did i mention I like this new shaver?
customer_reviews.author: Free Press Sandra

customer_reviews.title: BIG DISAPPOINTMENT
customer_reviews.text: HAD LAST NORELCO ELECTRIC RAZOR FOR DECADES. WORKED WITH OUT FAIL. BOUGHT THIS ONE April 26, 2017. PN OUT MY LIST!!
customer_reviews.author: Cynical

customer_reviews.title: Quality is long gone.
customer_reviews.text: It's a Norelco. I have always had Norelcos. I expected the same quality and performance as in the past. So I threw away all the packing slips, packaging etc. First time used was this morning and my neck looks and feels like I used a piece of broken glass to shave. What happened to you guys? I used to be able to depend on your products.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: First time using any type of shaver and it’s was worth my money
customer_reviews.text: This was my first time buying a any type of shaver and it was worth the money. I love how it shaved away hard part of my face that I can’t reach. I now have a clean shaven face with no growing facial hair.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Did not work for me
customer_reviews.text: Did not work for me, more pulling than shaving. Causes redness on neck. Maybe u might have better luck.
customer_reviews.author: Jonas

customer_reviews.title: Very much entry level
customer_reviews.text: Ultimately returned this. Doesn't shave closely at all and takes 8 hours to fully charge with short battery span. It's just not worth it with so many other great options out there for the same price.
customer_reviews.author: Winnie

customer_reviews.title: Almost impossible to clean
customer_reviews.text: I like the razor itself. and it does give a pretty close shave for this old manual razor user, but... This thing is almost impossible to clean thoroughly! It is an absolute nightmare to reassemble. There are apparently little key ways under the blades that must me aligned properly in order to get the heads back in the correct position. Since the keys and the ways are both black and relatively small, the only way to line them up is by feel. You can do it, but your going to be very frustrated with it by the time you get i back together correctly. If you like to torture people and small animals, give them this razor.
customer_reviews.author: Capt. Larry Spisak

customer_reviews.title: Hard to clean up strays with coarse hair
customer_reviews.text: I have coarse hair. However, that shouldn't stop a shaver from being effective. The Norelco would leave several hairs behind no matter which direction I went. Then, after trying multiple directions to remove them, my skin would become irritated. This happened on my neck frequently but I had the hardest time shaving my sideburns. The razor just left too many hairs behind. I had to use my safety razor to clean that up. I also found the trimmer to be mostly useless on my sideburns. As far as quality goes, the razor was easy to clean with water and heads were easy to replace. The charge holds well too. It's comfortable to hold and isn't loud like vibrating shavers.
customer_reviews.author: phlacoe

customer_reviews.title: Spend a little more and get a lot more
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to replace a Norelco shaver that we've had and loved for years. I spent a similar amount on our last one so expected similar quality. Unfortunately, this has not provided as close a shave and the trimmer on the back is not a close shave whatsoever. It does such a poor job that it's been sitting in our cabinet and I'm still using the old one despite it making weird noises and starting to fall apart. I'd suggest spending a little more money to get a better quality product. If we still had the option to return this shaver we would have!
customer_reviews.author: AmazonDad

customer_reviews.title: good quality
customer_reviews.text: I finally purchased a new Norelco, after the old one that I've had for over 15 years, finally wore out. My only negative, so far, is the fact that I can't use this with the cord attached; it has be unplugged from its cord/charger to work. I haven't used it enough yet to determine that the charge will last as long as others here have reported, but considering that I've had to leave the old one plugged in constantly to shave, well, this new one has already been a refreshing experience. Very lightweight, and it gives me a nice, close shave. I consider my beard/whiskers to be moderate. Anyway, you can't beat the price of this one!
customer_reviews.author: ChazW

customer_reviews.title: Better than the more expensive "3D" version!
customer_reviews.text: I forgot my fancy Philips 3D head on a trip so I purchased this low cost one as a temporary replacement. Low and Behold, this one shaves far better and faster than the more expensive one!!! Now, to be fair, I have to say that the heads of the other one were about a year old compared to the brand new ones on this one. But I definitely do not remember my fancy one shaving so quickly and thoroughly even when brand new! On top of that, this one has a much deeper "cavity" behind that heads so it does not clog up as fast as the other one. I am sure this affects the efficiency as well.
customer_reviews.author: Bo Struye

customer_reviews.title: Really good
customer_reviews.text: My son does not like the texture of shaving lotion, so I ordered this shaver for him. The shaver is very good. The charge lasts forever, it's lightweight and shaves pretty well. It did not come with a cleaning brush, so I use an old toothbrush. Without cleaning out the hair, the shaver of course does not cut as well. The flip out trimmer is awesome to trim prior to a closer shave. I feel it could be a bit more ergonomic for the shape of a face, but it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Frugalista

customer_reviews.title: Shaves almost as close as the real thing, fair price
customer_reviews.text: Used a Fusion for the past many years. Before that, other great blades. Started on Plavix 2 months ago and started to suffer mucho bleeding with a blade - not Gillette's fault. So this battery-operated Norelco was an immediate purchase. It does the job, almost as close as a blade, with little effort. And it seems to last long enough on a single charge. Not a bad price, either.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As expected
customer_reviews.text: I mainly use this product to shave my head. The tip is too big and it does not help me get the small parts of hair. And also i clearly cannot shape my beard with this. It gives me rashes when i use it on my armpits but that is probably my skin problem. It is not too strong and i have to shave the same spot over and over again. The battery life is good. I used it for around 30 mins without having to charge it. And cleaning is so easy as it is waterproof. I just keep it under running water and it is clean.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Speed demon with a flaw
customer_reviews.text: I own shavers from several manufacturers....some on the expensive side...this one is by far the fastest to thoroughly remove my stubble. This is the third one I owned in the last five years....the others had NiMH batteries which failed relatively quickly...I hope the LiON batteries this has are more robust. What I don't like is that you cannot use it while it's charging so that if you pick it up depleted you need to wait until it's charged before it would turn on. You could use the old models plugged in while they were charging. I value the speed however and willing to live with the charging flaw.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Lady legs
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to shave my lady legs. I used a Phillips pink electric thing forever. None of these things give a great close shave, but this one is pretty good if 1) your legs are completely dry 2) very short hair growth, like 1/8" or less. It appears to hold a decent charge, has a little extra flip clipper for stubborn patches or bikini line. The top pops open for easy cleaning. Doesn't cut skin, very smooth operation. I don't know why they don't market these to women?! So abnoxious.
customer_reviews.author: JenSweets11

customer_reviews.title: Takes awhile to shave off but does the job!
customer_reviews.text: I shave up and down, sideways, and in circles -- slow and fast. Still I can feel roughness on my face. One or two passes over an area is never enough. It takes me a good half hour to get a satisfactory shave. By the time I am finished, the charge is weakening. This description, unfortunately, fits every electric shaver I have ever had. I can't be sure if the problem lies with the device or the user. On the definite positive side, this is the fastest and easiest shaver to clean that I have ever had. It is very quiet and does not awaken my wife in the mornings.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Dee

customer_reviews.title: Best Electric Razor
customer_reviews.text: This razor functioned way beyond my expectations. I had a very expensive electric razor that had worn out. I had very low expectations for this Norelco S1560/81 Shaver 2100. When I tried it for the first time I had a 3 day growth of beard. This razor was very light in my hand and removed that beard so easily and without razor burn. I was reluctant to run water on the head to clean it, but it was perfect to clean the razor. This has to be one of the best values in electric razors and the reviews are what made me take the chance. Thank you, Norelco.
customer_reviews.author: Skip Wood

customer_reviews.title: A good, inexpensive razor.
customer_reviews.text: I like Norelco cuz they last and are much less expensive in the long run than blades, but I haven't bought a new one for many years. Perhaps because my old Norelco is wearing out, and perhaps because the quality is better, this new one surprised me with it's quick work and comfort. The price is right and I see no reason to spend twice this price for the more fancy razors. The fact it doesn't work with the cord plugged in is a shame, so I'll just have to keep my old one, that does work with the cord, as a backup.
customer_reviews.author: P. J.

customer_reviews.title: This is a great shaver, I use it for my legs and underarms
customer_reviews.text: This is a great shaver, I use it for my legs and underarms instead of a regular shaver as a woman and find this to be much less time consuming and less expensive in the long run, years later it still works great! Using these on the underarms is a skill in itself you just have to tip it at an angle and not hold it flat on the skin or it can grab your fragile underarm skin and leave little knicks.
customer_reviews.author: Kara

customer_reviews.title: stopped cutting after 4 months
customer_reviews.text: At first I loved this. I mainly used it for cleaning up a days stubble on my face. As time went on it just stopped cutting...at all. I keep it clean and it's fully charged but doesn't cut anymore. I currently have one day beard growth and try to cut it like in the past, but nothing is happening. I bought this on April 20.2020 and today is Sept 20,2020. I have rarely given less than 5 star reviews, but I feel I should bring this to the consumers attention.
customer_reviews.author: Russ LeMaster

customer_reviews.title: Battery life is terrible!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've owned many of these in the past 30 years... this one has the WORST battery life I've ever come across. In all honestly its only good for 2 full shaves, then you MUST plug it in and recharge it!!! Annoying and inconvenient. Normally I go weeks before recharging my other Phillips Norelco rechargeable shavers. It cuts well when the battery has the power to do so. Keep the recharging cord close by!
customer_reviews.author: Riggs

customer_reviews.title: Great Shave!  Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Can't say enough good things about this shaver! It shaves great - easy to use and shaves close without pulling. Lightweight and easy to clean. Very quiet too. Great value. If I had to find one thing about it I wish was different it would be there is no indication of the battery charge remaining when you are using or shut off the shaver. The only way to check is to plug it in, and even then it is by "how fast" a single LED blinks. Holds a charge well enough though for a week of shaves on a single charge.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as I hoped
customer_reviews.text: I got this after a friend visited me and had one and as needed a new razor I decided to get it after have a Braun for twelve or so years. The first one did not charge properly and never indicated a full charge so Norelco sent me a new one which was OK but really did not like it compared to my old Braun. Returned it to Amazon and ordered a Braun and just received it and no coparison to the shave. Love those Brauns. Twice the price but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: DMAdam47

customer_reviews.title: I would recommend this razor to friends and anyone who wants a ...
customer_reviews.text: For the price, this razor is a major bargain. I have a black (and silver) beard, sensitive skin and a five o'clock shadow at 10 am. When I finish shaving every day, my face feels as soft and free of stubble as if I ripped my face up with an old fashioned non-electric razor. I would recommend this razor to friends and anyone who wants a great shave without nicks and cuts.
customer_reviews.author: Larry S. Singer

customer_reviews.title: Battery good sharpness didnt last
customer_reviews.text: I got my Norelco electric razorand I charged it overnight. The next day I used it to shave my head and wow it cut great! I solely purchased it for head shaving so I could cut my hair every three days before I go on shift. I got a total of 4.5 cuts less than 1 month UNFORTUNATELY and it was dull I didn’t even get halfway with the last cut and had to use the razor blade. To finish. I was within my 1 month window for returns and I have only returned 1 other item and Amazon Customer service was awesome as usual. Sharpness should last min 6 months fix this and its a great shaver!
customer_reviews.author: Adrian

customer_reviews.title: We just weren't meant for each other.
customer_reviews.text: I have an older model and thought instead of buying new parts to buy a new razor. To be fair, I should say that I have extremely sensitive skin and a light beard. The shaver felt like it was trying to shave my skin or pluck the hairs instead of cutting them. I was disappointed but Philips was quick to send a RMA and refund my purchase price. I'll be fixing my older model. I love Norelco shavers just not this one.
customer_reviews.author: Rhode Turtle

customer_reviews.title: Great razor, just wish the refills weren't so expensive.
customer_reviews.text: I like this razor just fine. The only beef I have with it is when I go to purchase refills they are $28. For $11 more I get a whole new unit and fresh battery, etc. The battery lasts about 2 weeks for me. It only takes me a few minutes a day to clean up with this. I wish the pop up trimmer was narrower so it could be more useful for nose hair. It would be nice if they would engineer this thing to work plugged in. Let's say you owned this for years and the battery was shot. Now you either disassemble it and internally rewire it to work without the battery or you toss it.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: great product and long battery
customer_reviews.text: great product and long battery. the battery life has lasted so long since i first bought that i do not remember, but has been several weeks. first chg took a long time to complete and i just chg'd again for second time yesterday since i was going on trip and it was done quick, so i am guessing that the battery was battery was since pretty full. SUPER easy to clean and very happy with shaver
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great design with clever features, although it does irritate a little if used on dry skin
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic trimmer with ingenious design. Almost impossible to cut yourself with it, and it leaves your skin smoother than most electric razors (of course, not as smooth as a standard non-electric razor, but pretty close). The razor collects the trimmings, which can be easily cleaned out by popping open the top and giving it a good rinse and shake. There is also a standard blade on the back for trimming longer hair that pops out, even while the razor is on. Overall, great design. The best electric razor I have ever owned. Deducted a star because it does irritate my face a bit (only for about 10 minutes). Well worth it for the time saved.
customer_reviews.author: Aleksandr Superczynski

customer_reviews.title: Cut beards, not quality.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this, and two previous similar models. They hold the price, but cut the quality. Previous one would run a couple weeks without charging. No way on this one. Lower voltage, slower speed, and shorter battery life. No carry case, shorter cord on charger; they managed to cut corners I did not know existed. Probably saved them a dollar a unit. On the plus side, it's well waterproofed. Yippee.
customer_reviews.author: Citizen Can

customer_reviews.title: Got the job done
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this after having surgery for a broken leg and ankle so I couldn't shower/shave that leg like I normally would. It worked ok on long hair but didn't work quite as good on stuble. It may work better if you have thicker hair like for your beard. Also if I wasn't very careful it caused a rash on the more sensitive parts of my like like the back of my knee and inner thigh.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Norelco
customer_reviews.text: The old Norelco was a gift 12 years ago and since it was his birthday decided to get him a newer version and honestly these are the most dependable, and the sizing is right, so many are too large and cumbersome and do not hold up or look great after a short period or perform as well as this one has. Very comfortable to hold, easy to clean, great shaving head and look great!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Garbage. You get what you pay for. Leaves hairs no matter how many passes you make
customer_reviews.text: I don't even use this any more. The blades just do not leave a clean shave. I have to keep going over and over the same area to get all the little hairs, which eventually irritates my neck and cheeks. I had a 3160 model for about 11 years.. it was also the budget model like this and worked flawlessly until it finally died. But the quality of the blades has obviously gone way downhill in the last decade, because this 2100 model is absolute GARBAGE. Shame on you Phillips for giving us such a poor performing product.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: The shaver started to cause problems 17 months after I ...
customer_reviews.text: The shaver started to cause problems 17 months after I bought it. I had it fixed twice within the warranty term, but it went completely dead less than a year later. I have had Phlilips shavers over the last 40 years, and most of them lasted many years. I had assumed that Norelco products are identical to Phillips, so while in the US I bought this shaver, but I was later told by a guy in a shop that sells and fixes shavers in Israel, that Norelco's quality is not on par with Phillips. I just bought a new Phillips shaver (paid some more) and am looking forward to finding out how long it will serve me.
customer_reviews.author: Amiram Yehudai

customer_reviews.title: Great Shaver and very precise!  At great price!
customer_reviews.text: The shaver is very precise and trims the hairs very finely. After using this shaver, I am very impressed. This shaver has been very useful in clearing up my scratchy facial hair. I typically do not like any hair on my face but have always used a manual razor because I felt they were the most precise. I’m in love all the wonderful little features this razor has. Like other more expensive electric shaver it does a nice job of contouring to the face for a close shave.
customer_reviews.author: SALOME

customer_reviews.title: Good unit for the money
customer_reviews.text: I’ve never been one for electric razors but I purchased this electric razor about three months ago and I must say, that it has grown on me. Are used to be a diehard razor guy but now it seems every time I turn around I’m grabbing the Electric razor and shaving. It turns out to be a pretty convenient way to get a shave and it works pretty good too. I would recommend this unit if you’re looking for a starter unit as the price is pretty low.
customer_reviews.author: Joe .m

customer_reviews.title: Better than a foil razor
customer_reviews.text: I had used three different Panasonic Smooth Operator foil razors over the past 20 years. The last one was over $80 and never really worked great. This Philips Norelco rotary razor works great and fast and gets the beard below the chin much better than the foil razors. I don't miss the battery indicator on my last foil razor, especially since the display failed after about a year. I just charge this one every few days. It is also much easier to clean than the foil razor. At this price point I am totally sold.
customer_reviews.author: Martie C

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Razor for a woman
customer_reviews.text: Despite the order mix up that my post office did of their own, Amazon’s customer service was tremendous for understanding my frustration.. Now- onto this pretty awesome Phillips. I am a woman & have unwanted hairs that we just won’t discuss, but! This electric shaver helps with all of my issues with hair on me., I purchased this product about a year ago & it still works like a charm. When I rinse mines out i make sure to leave all of the door flaps open to dry.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: It's okay..
customer_reviews.text: It's an okay Razer. I was hoping to see a higher quality out of it without shelling big bucks for a nice one but alas. It does pull and can't handle quarantine level hair growth very well.
customer_reviews.author: Josh M.

customer_reviews.title: Best shaver ever
customer_reviews.text: Once fully charged, you can use the shaver more than 5 times before it needs a recharge. I leave this in my vehicle and use it when I drive to work. My face is not nearly as oily after using this shaver compared to the variety of sensitive skin shaving gel plus straight razor products I've tried. Also, when camping, this shaver doesn't require water.
customer_reviews.author: nick

customer_reviews.title: Great price, good shave.
customer_reviews.text: Use it for my head and face. Great price, good shave. TIPS: DO NOT rinse it under water to clean, it will gunk up the heads fast. Empty after each use. Disassemble and use an old toothbrush to clean the heads every few weeks. See videos on YouTube to sharpen heads using a mirror and metal polish (Every few months). I just wish I could use it while plugged in.
customer_reviews.author: Consumer

customer_reviews.title: Useless, dull, and a waste of money.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my father and am leaving a detailed review for him: Do NOT purchase this shaver. No matter how much time he spent, he could not achieve a decent shave - he even just about jammed it against his skin, but it was futile. This was his very first use, so either the blades came dulled or the product itself is useless. VERY unhappy with the quality - even the twenty dollar shaver he picked up from the drugstore gave him a good, close shave the first few times! But not this one. Stick with a quality shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Meditation

customer_reviews.title: as I like the closer shave that a traditional razor provides
customer_reviews.text: My husband uses this shaver, and I borrowed it to try using it on my legs before getting my own. It works very well on my thighs where my hair grows in baffling ways, switching directions at random and generally being unsightly and difficult to tame. I use this for all leg-shaving above the knee, and it's much quicker than shaving with a traditional razor. I haven't switched for below-the-knee, as I like the closer shave that a traditional razor provides.
customer_reviews.author: A. C.

customer_reviews.title: Love this Razor!
customer_reviews.text: I was reading some negative reviews about Norelco razors so thought I'd try a different brands. Boy was that every a bad Idea. Bought a Phisco. It pulled out more hairs than it cut. Stopped using it bought this and it just glided over my face smoothly cutting my beard like it was gliding on ice. Absolutely love this thing. Can't comment on the battery life but for a great shave I love this razor.
customer_reviews.author: Trucker Ed

customer_reviews.title: Terrific razor
customer_reviews.text: Not having ever used an electric razor I didn’t know how if I’d like it so I bought the least expensive unit that had good reviews. I was patient getting used to it, and I’m delighted with this inexpensive norelco. I thought I might begin with this and move up as I got comfortable with it, but I believe I’ll stay with this one, as it is very adequate to my needs.
customer_reviews.author: Lance

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing product
customer_reviews.text: I do not find that this shaver delivers a reasonably close shave even with efforts to stretch one's facial skin taut. It is cheaply made and runs like a toy. Just did not work for me, and I've made an effort to get used to using it. I count this as my error for buying in at the low end of the prices for electric shaver, despite the shaver being listed as a Best Seller. I used to use a Remington foil shaver for many years with consistent success. This Norelco shaver I will discard and try again...
customer_reviews.author: Russell Tomlin

customer_reviews.title: close and comfortable shave
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this brad of shaver for over 40 years and always had good results. This shaver cost me less then one did 20 years ago and the shave is excellent. I feel it is an excellent buy.
customer_reviews.author: john j

customer_reviews.title: Great comfortable razor
customer_reviews.text: This is a great basic razor. I wouldn't go get a super expensive one- this is all I needed. I get a close and comfortable shave with no irritation. In fact, I'm not sure why people get those really expensive versions, because I couldn't ask for a better shave. When I shaved with a blade, I consistently got those red folliculitis dots. I get no red dots with this shaver. The battery lasts a long time. I go weeks between charges. I'm also bald and I shave my head with this- works just as well as it does on my face.
customer_reviews.author: Justanotherdude

customer_reviews.title: This thing sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap . Does not work as well as previous version (diff model# but same cast)... now using older model more often and that one went downhill after replacing blades. This new one is not well constructed...for one, the top portion fell off into the sink full of water when I merely clicked the Open button to clear out stubble. Whole thing into water! So after 2 months the shave itself is inferior as I constantly have to go back into bathroom to do touch up work... it always misses spots after first (thorough) pass. It's not liek I'm going too fast with it, quite the opposite. Just not happy, wish I went elsewhere. Again, previous Norelco model was just fine.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very good design.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second razor. Very fast shaving and cleanup. I don't know why the blades have been nicking me lately. I bought a new set and they act the same. It makes me wonder if they've changed blade vendors last year? They used to be better. I use and enjoy the use of the sideburn pop up. My wife cleans up the back of my neck and eyebrows with it too,
customer_reviews.author: carol  wilson

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly average!
customer_reviews.text: Good shaver for the price. Is it a good shaver? Well, it is a $30.00 shaver. You have to apply a lot of force to get a good shave, which I am not that thrilled with, you like to get minimal force on the skin to prevent wrinkles and sagging to collagen. Battery lasts a while on a charge. You cannot use the shaver straight up off the wire, which is a down fall. It is an okay shaver overall.
customer_reviews.author: Luke in Upstate

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I kind of hate to dis this razor given the price point, however, compared to my old remington, it was like a toy. Sounds and acts like it isn't powerful enough to do the job, plus takes several swipes to get even close to a blade shave. I found that I was itching after shaving with it because of the fine stubble remaining. I sent it back and ordered a remington - hope it will be like my last - not sure why I tried a norelco again - probably their more expensive razors are different.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lacks necessary feature
customer_reviews.text: This shaver is designed with a defect. While it is charging, plugged into wall socket, the shaver will not operate. That means if the battery goes dead while you are shaving, it's necessary to recharge the shaver before you can continue. That's a drop dead issue for me. I do not have time to wait on a recharge before finishing shaving. I've returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver, just buy it
customer_reviews.text: I think Philips Norelco make the best electric shavers. This is my second one, the last one held up for 15 years. They have more expensive models than this one, but honestly I think this one shaves so well, and the charge lasts a long time, it's not worth stressing over the minor differences. Just buy it, you will be happy.
customer_reviews.author: Erky

customer_reviews.title: Falls Apart When I open to clean
customer_reviews.text: I had my previous Norelco for4 years. I got this new one and every time I open it up to clean it, the blades and that triangular piece fallout. I can not get it put back together. I called the company one time and they helped me reassemble it. Several months later it fell out again. I have had it. Should not have this problem with a name brand razor like this,
customer_reviews.author: Thomas L

customer_reviews.title: A good deal and low cost for a razor than works.
customer_reviews.text: A good product for being an older style rotary shaving product. It gets the job done for very little cost. It even out preforms the more expensive razors that are on the market. The blades don’t cost an arm and leg to replace, they last for a long time before they need to be changed out.
customer_reviews.author: budblitz

customer_reviews.title: Electric Shaver
customer_reviews.text: Usually I am a regular razor blade shaver but I decided to give this a try. I like it. Shaves nicely and close to the skin. The only drawback is that the beard cannot be too long because it will take a while to shave. Other than that the battery life is great, not to difficult to clean and holds nice in your hand.
customer_reviews.author: Japan Treasure Hunters

customer_reviews.title: Great shave
customer_reviews.text: When I first turned it on, the motor sounded weak and slow compared to my old Braun which sounded like a lawnmower. What a surprise, when it translated into a great shave. I am very impressed with this product
customer_reviews.author: ontheway

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good, but time consuming.
customer_reviews.text: At first, I thought this shaver was terrible. It left me with redness, irritation and it didn't even fully shave the hairs. However, I kept shaving consistently and the results changed SIGNIFICANTLY. Now, this shaver gives me amazing results that are similar or even better than my traditional razor. However, to get this result it does take some time. I have to go over some tougher areas such as my chin or moustache multiple times to get a close shave. But since this is an electric shaver, I could do this with a mirror while watching TV, so honeslty I really couldn't care!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I am going to keep it since I should have known better than to expect a quality machine art since a ...
customer_reviews.text: I have been use to using a safety razor for years but thought I would try electric again. This was a disapointment. Years ago I used Braun which was ok. But this lacks power .. I am going to keep it since I should have known better than to expect a quality machine at since a low price. Buyer be aware. This is a cheap excuse for a razor. I would suggest going for quality if you go electric.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Luas

customer_reviews.title: Happy with my purchase
customer_reviews.text: I had one of the more expensive Aquatec shavers and after 5 years, decided to stop working. So I bought this knowing that it will not work in the shower (you can get it wet for cleaning, but will not operate when wet). The shave is clean and quick. Does not pull on beard. Even my sensitive facial areas are shaved close and clean without irritation
customer_reviews.author: Mom

customer_reviews.title: Good no-frills shaver
customer_reviews.text: I always liked the philips style shavers better than the braun ones, and this one doesn't dissapoint. It's not fancy, it's not shiny but it works very well and gives a good shave and trim. Very easy to clean - all you need to do is pop the top and wash it under the faucet, no worries, the electronics won't get wet.
customer_reviews.author: Ofer

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I realize the saying "You get what you pay for" ......but this razor fall's short of the $50.00 I paid . Phillips razors aren't any where that they used to be ....unless you want to pay $100.00 for one ......my old Phillips razor lasted years 17 at a cost of $68.00
customer_reviews.author: Mike W

customer_reviews.title: 2100 Shaver
customer_reviews.text: Works good, but feels like it doesn't have enough power. Before I bought the 2100, I purchased the 1500 (or may be 1000) with an electric cord. The shaver with the electric cord has more power and shaves very well for less the cost. I will keep the 2100 cordless as a spare.
customer_reviews.author: John DeCristofano

customer_reviews.title: Decent budget-friendly shaver
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son who entered college. Before he used it, I tested it. It did a decent job but for the price, I can't complain. My son is low-maintenance so he thinks it's great. I personally use a razor but will soon buy an electric one but not this one.
customer_reviews.author: 1Ch410Hoo

customer_reviews.title: Bad quality razor
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for my father and it lasted 3 months and now I am having to buy another razor. Battery quit taking a charge and it quit working all together! Contacted Amazon they said I would have to contact the manufacturer because it was outside the return window. Purchased a different name brand razor and the quality is like night and day. No problems so far!
customer_reviews.author: Noelle Belle

customer_reviews.title: Great shaver for the price. No need to go more expensive.
customer_reviews.text: Product arrived in original packaging in good condition, Shaver works as well as the $200 one that I bought my husband a couple years back. Has the flip up trimmer on the back as well. Easy to take apart and put back together for cleaning. I would recommend this Shaver over other more expensive ones where cost is a consideration. The only benefit I can see of the $200 one to this one is that the more expensive came with it's own cleaning system but this required the purchase of "cleanser packs" where this shaver is content with being opened, emptied, brushed out and oiled and the replacement blade cartridges are easy to obtain and install.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela

customer_reviews.title: Not as good as the expensive ones
customer_reviews.text: I needed new heads and my rechargeable batteries were worn out so I opted for a new Phillips Norelco similar to my old one. The new motor is louder than my old one and the new heads don't cut any closer than my old shaver. Guess I should have gotten a more expensive model.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: Norelco is the best
customer_reviews.text: I have always bought Norelco, and wouldn't buy any thing else. The only thing I don't like about this one (and the reason for four stars) is that you can't use it while it's plugged in. I used my last one long after it quit charging by leaving it plugged in. Guess the manufacturer didn't like owners doing that. So, they fixed it so, when it quits charging, you have to buy another.
customer_reviews.author: David Ford

customer_reviews.title: Closer then my razor
customer_reviews.text: I tried an electric shaver about 15 years ago and wasn't impressed. For whatever reason I thought I would try again and bought this Norelco. It shaves better then my razor did on my neck. I could never get close enough on my neck without razor burn when using razors. Now with the Norelco I finally have smooth stubble-less skin around my neck.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald Joseph

customer_reviews.title: An Good, Inexpensive Shaver
customer_reviews.text: I have owned Norelco's for many years and have always been satisfied. They last forever - just replace the cutting heads every once in a great while and they keep on trucking. My last shaver was a more expensive version than this one is, and I like it better. But, for a backup shaver, or for traveling, this is a good shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Larry O. Walton

customer_reviews.title: Great first razor for teen. Excellent price/value
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my son as a first razor. I didn't want to spend a ton on a first razor but was a little worried that this would't get the job done because it was so inexpensive. It was perfect though and he's been using it for almost 5 months with no problem. It works well and I don't have to worry about him cutting his face. I will buy this again for my other sons when they become teens.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. & Mrs. Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't shave! No kidding.
customer_reviews.text: It simply doesn't cut hair. It doesn't shave. It's as if the blades were not included in the head. Either it's a truly lousy product or I was shipped some kind of an imitation knockoff. Had I known this soon after I'd given it to my dad, I'd have returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Been There

customer_reviews.title: Good shaver for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good product for the price, it gets the job done when you have to be out the door in a hurry. Little difficult to trim around the beard, goaty, side burns but it comes with a line trimmer which is a great addition to the product. I feel sometimes it pulls the hair. If you try to overuse your skins will burn like the blades rubbed it, nothing crazy just done over do it.
customer_reviews.author: Gman

customer_reviews.title: First electric shaver and will stick with it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift for my husband and he loved it! He usually shaves once or twice a week with his Gillette but since he got this one he shaves every other day Pros: -The battery's life lasts for 45 minutes, once you get the hang of it you will only need 5-10 minutes per shave making it almost usable for an entire week if you shave every other day - as mentioned above, very fast and efficient, you only need 5-10 minutes to shave - charges overnight and ready in the morning Cons -none so far
customer_reviews.author: Dee Tharan

customer_reviews.title: close shave / easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: I had to replace an inexpensive shaver. There were several razors to choose from on Amazon all within a few dollars in price. I decided to go with a name I recognized and I am glad that I did. This razor was made in The Netherlands. I have a light beard, shave most mornings. and rinse it every other shave under running water. A charge lasts me at least a month. I am very pleased with this razor.
customer_reviews.author: AJS

customer_reviews.title: Very good basic razor
customer_reviews.text: I had the much more expensive Norelco 8260XL but it needed a new set of blades, It turns out the blades were just a little cheaper than this basic razor. This one takes longer to charge and the charge doesn't last as long but the shave is just as good as my expensive one. This is a good shaver for the money.
customer_reviews.author: W. T. Traylor

customer_reviews.title: Really disappointed. High price does not equal high value.
customer_reviews.text: I decided to pay a little more than I would have wanted for what I expected to be a high quality razor. I've used a small phillips norelco battery travel shaver for some time and it was pretty good but I wanted a bigger charge-operated one. This razor is terrible. It misses hairs even if you go over the same spot slowly 10x. I've never used a more frustrating razor before. Something about the angle of the blades also prevents it from running smoothly across your face. After a few weeks of trying this out, I decided to just throw it out. Terrible product. I don't understand how it has 8,000+ positive reviews.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Ham

customer_reviews.title: Clean cut
customer_reviews.text: I do not know why I waited so long yo buy an electric shaver to shave my head. I hate to shave. I put it off for days, now that I am retired and do not care about presentation. With this device it is so fast and so easy. I am definitely going to be more presentable from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Francisco

customer_reviews.title: This electric shaver works nicely and safely.
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these electric shavers for my husband. The flip up feature on the first one did not work well. It broke pretty quickly. I have to reattach it after cleaning. The second shaver is made better and the flip feature works fine. The shaver does a nice job. No nicks or bleeding while shaving.
customer_reviews.author: shopgal

customer_reviews.title: ladies, you gotta get one!
customer_reviews.text: As a woman...i love this thing! Why have I never tried one! It saved me a bunch of time!
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Moore

customer_reviews.title: Good shave but lousy charge
customer_reviews.text: It gives a close enough shave and it's easy to clear. The battery life suck. You have to plug it in for up to 8hrs for a full charge and can't use it while it's plugged. I plug it in for a good while and then use it for a few minutes. If you don't mind the battery life, I recommend it for the price and shave.
customer_reviews.author: Waters

customer_reviews.title: I miss my old safety razor.
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my face decent looking. I charge the battery every week. Quick cleaning with water. I hold onto it with no problems. My face is a bloody mess when I use my safety razor because my skin has become thin in my old age(84) and my prescription blood thinners. I have used electric razors before and this is better than any other I have used over the years. I'm pleased with how well it does.
customer_reviews.author: Lum

customer_reviews.title: Glad I traded in my old shaver!
customer_reviews.text: I had purchased this almost a week ago and I can firmly advise that it was well worth the price. The three prongs make the whole process a lot safer compared to traditional razors, and the device does well to shave those tricky areas around the face. The device can simply be plugged in to a wall outlet to charge and when testing the battery the shaver ran for a total of 3 hours before running out of juice. I'd well recommend this product to anyone who wants a quick and easy shave, and more so to the fathers and mothers of teens who want to get their children a safe shaver.
customer_reviews.author: Araki

customer_reviews.title: Let's see company response
customer_reviews.text: This little shaver seemed very good, worked well, simple enough for my dad to use, ergonomic and lightweight however, it stopped working and my window of return closed March 28th. I am not with that and feel they should accept this for return.
customer_reviews.author: OC Girls

customer_reviews.title: All I need for a close shave
customer_reviews.text: This electric shaver, when used with a pre-shave oil, is all I need for a close shave. I compared the shave quality of the Norelco with a Gillette Mach 3 and found that the Norelco is just about as good. It's easier to touch-up with the Mach 3, but overall I think the shave quality is equal. The benefit of the Norelco to me is that I can get that shave in less than half the time it takes with a regular razor. I have to stress, though, that I consider the pre-shave oil to be a necessity when using this shaver.
customer_reviews.author: ForensicBeanCounter

customer_reviews.title: Battery not changeable
customer_reviews.text: Description called it a corded shaver but you can't shave with it plugged in-After using several times I checked on how to change the battery and found out that you can't , you're supposed to throw it away and buy a new one! How dumb is that? If that info had been in the description I would have never bought this model.
customer_reviews.author: lab pro

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good for the price
customer_reviews.text: For the price this works fairly well. I do need to go over the same spot multiple times in order to get a relatively cleaner shave, though still not as clean as I'd like. Battery life seems ok as it lasts about a week. I wouldn't wait until it's completely dead before recharging though because of the long time that it takes to recharge. Cleaning it seems fine as you can run it under water as suggested by the manual. All in all it seems pretty good for the price.
customer_reviews.author: ATAGENT

customer_reviews.title: Nice close shave.
customer_reviews.text: Nice electric shaver. I get about 5 or 6 shaves between charges but I use it to shave my face and head. Provides a close shave so it leaves no stubble behind. It will pull hairs out the first few shaves but once the blades get worn in that pretty much disappears.
customer_reviews.author: Byron Cummings

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY went electric
customer_reviews.text: Been using disposable blade razors for decades; that's what my Dad used. They work but I should have switched to electric long ago. The shave isn't quite as smooth as the soap and blade shave, but it's good enough . . . . and my face never bleeds. I'm very satisfied with this Norelco 2100. And the price is right.
customer_reviews.author: P.S.

product_meta.title: Philips Norelco S1560/81 Shaver 2100 Rechargeable Wet Electric Shaver, with Pop-up Trimmer, 0.851 pounds
product_meta.description:
The Philips Norelco Shaver 2100 guarantees a smooth result with a convenient, cordless shave every time at an affordable price. 4 direction flex heads move independently in 4 directions and automatically adjusts to every curve of your face, neck and jaw line for a smooth shave. Easy to clean with Lithium-ion battery that delivers 35 minutes of shaving time. The pop-up trimmer is perfect for maintaining a mustache and quick trimming. 

Shaving Tips: Use your new shaver exclusively for 3 weeks to fully enjoy the closeness of a Philips Norelco shave. At first you may not get as close a shave as you expect, or your face may even become slightly irritated. This is normal since your beard and skin will need time to adjust. Invest 3 weeks and you’ll soon experience the full joy of your new shaver. Stick with it! If you alternate shaving methods during the adjustment period, it may make it more difficult to adapt to the Philips Norelco shaving system.

BRAND STORY
By Philips
feature_bullets: The Philips Norelco Shaver 2100 guarantees a smooth result with a convenient, cordless shave every time at an affordable price
Protect your skin with our unique shaving system; The Close Cut Blade system with self sharpening blades is engineered to give you a reliable close shave every time
4 direction flex heads move independently in 4 directions and automatically adjusts to every curve of your face, neck and jaw line for a smooth shave
One touch open for easy cleaning; Simply pop the heads open and rinse thoroughly under the tap
The rechargeable Lithium ion battery delivers the power of a corded shaver without the hassle of a cord; 35 minutes of shaving time

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
